item.title: Abandoned and untaxed vehicle, 29th August
item.description:
I am writing to formally report a vehicle that appears to have been abandoned on Lakeside, Beckenham. The vehicle has remained stationary for approximately three months and is currently untaxed. None of the local residents have identified themselves as the owner, and the vehicle is occupying a residents’ parking space, which is in high demand within the area. Its continued presence is causing inconvenience to those who legitimately require access to parking. In light of the above, I respectfully request that the Council investigates the matter and undertakes the necessary enforcement action regarding the removal of the vehicle. Thank you for your assistance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakeside, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red paint graffiti, 29th August
item.description:
Red paint intended to be St George’s Cross flags have been painted on pedestrian crossings along Shooters Hill rd and on the mini roundabout on Old Dover rd. This needs to be removed asap as it is causing community distress. The rise of fascism and hatred is underpinned by these rudimentary’flags’ and it’s very worrying, especially in our ethnically diverse community. I have also reported this to the police.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 308, Shooters Hill Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign on post outside 76 king Harold’s way, 29th August
item.description:
The dog fowling sign is very old , faded and weathered, it is also very high on the post. Dog walkers do not notice it, and we are getting dogs fowling outside my property, and owners not picking it up. I reported this on case 8086671, which shows completed, but it hasn’t been done

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King Harolds Way, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders constantly blocking access to and from 12 Kemerton Road, 29th August
item.description:
Builders parking their many vans either side of a narrow road and deliveries parking in between. We have had missed bin collections in the past because of blocked access. Some residents in Meadowbrook (14 flats ) 12 Kemerton Road, have carers and the possibility of emergency services along with fire services if needed. This is difficult with the continuing non compliance from the building site. This has been going on for several months and will be on going into the new year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kemerton Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 29th August
item.description:
Triangle of grass and trees at the top of Wellington Road DA5 with the junction of Lodge Lane . Someone has bagged up rubbish and , I assume left it for the dustmen to collect however crows and foxes have had a nibble and there’s now rubbish everywhere making the place look terrible . Can this be cleaned up please .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lodge Lane, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
